page.title: 08WELLDRESSING
page.content: The frames for the well-dressing are made of wood with holes drilled in them so that the clay can be"plugged" to keep it in place. Ordinary clay is used and this is cleaned by getting the stones out and adding some water to make it soft.The clay is then thrown into the frames and smoothed off to form an even surface. A Biblical picture,which has previously been drawn on grease proof paper,is placed on the clay and the outline pricked out with a needle.The paper is removed and the outline of holes is covered with wool to form a picture on the clay. Flower petals,greenery and seeds such as sunflower seeds are then used to fill in the picture.Like painting,the colours must be shaded. When finished,the frames are put
